"ACCIPITRIFORMES"	"Accipitridae"	"Kites, Hawks and Eagles"	"Buteo"	"archeri"	"."	"Sclater, WL, 1918"	"Archer's Buzzard"	"AF"	"n Somalia"	"."	"PL"	"Archer's Buzzard is split from Augur Buzzard (Riesing et al 2003, HBW 2, cf Clark 2003) but possibly a rufous morph of Augur Buzzard. B. archeri. Often regarded as conspicific with B. augur, but appears not related to the B. augur/B. rufofuscus clade;  is basal to the clade that includes most of the African buteos (Riesing et al 2003). Genetic data require confirmation (Clark comment)."	"Buteo archeri"

"OTIDIFORMES"	"Otididae"	"Bustards"	"Eupodotis"	"caerulescens"	"."	"(Vieillot, 1820)"	"Blue Korhaan"	"AF"	"e South Africa"	"."	"TAX"	"Unsettled nomenclature. Usually attributed to (Vieillot, 1820) with spelling caerulescens. Predated by (Temminck, 1807) with spelling coerulescens but the latter published without a description. In the absence of a consensus, we follow the prevailing usage."	"Eupodotis caerulescens"

"PASSERIFORMES"	"Fringillidae"	"Finches"	"Hemignathus"	"wilsoni"	"."	"(Rothschild, 1893)"	"Akiapolaau"	"PO"	"Hawaiian Islands"	"."	"TAX"	"Akiapolaau Hemignathus wilsoni. Formerly H. munroi on the IOC list which was a name created by Pratt because if  Hawaii Amakihi is also placed in Hemignathus then its subspecies wilsoni has precedence.
